json.text: Let Scenic take you on an unforgettable journey
To discover the spectacular sights of Spain and Portugal.
From the magnificent architecture of their palaces and cathedrals, to the colour and
spectacle of their dancers, you’ll be astounded by the rich diversity of these fascinating countries.
Our journey begins in the vibrant city of Barcelona. Revitalised for the 1992 Olympics,
this picturesque city is renowned for Europe's best-preserved Gothic Quarter,
Gaudí's delightfully zany architecture,and galleries housing the treasures of Picasso
and Miró (Miro-mih-rOh).
A special highlight will be a visit to Gaudí's unfinished masterpiece…
The Cathedral of the Sagrada Familiaa visually stunning Cathedral and Barcelona's most important landmark.
Construction on Gaudi’s magical cathedral began in 1878 and although he died in 1926,
work has continued since then in an attempt to realise his dream.
It’s estimated that it won’t be complete until at least 2041!
Even though it is far from finished, this remarkable cathedral is well worth visiting.
We also visit Guell Park, a playful urban park featuring peaceful greens, winding paths
and many sculptures and mosaics designed by Gaudi himself.
Including gingerbread gatehouses,
patchwork lizards and much more.
Now you can find Gaudi’s influence over this city just about everywhere from churches
to city streets to homes, even landscape gardening like here in Park way, And as you can tell
by all these crowds, they absolutely love him.
Following the coastline south we’ll visit the fortified seaport of Pensicola before
our arrival to the coastal city of Valencia. Among the highlights of our included guided tour
will be the ‘City of Arts and Sciences’ – the most important modern tourist destination in the city.
From here we head to the hilltop town of Granada, nestled amongst the Sierra
Nevada, Spain's highest mountain range.
At the centrepiece of the city lies one of
the most brilliant jewels of world architecture …the Alhambra,
A series of magnificent palaces, fountains and gardens, built in the 14th century.
Within the Alhambra stands the massive Palace
of Charles the fifth, an outstanding example of Spanish Renaissance architecture.
Visit Sacromonte (Sac-Ro-Mone-E), famous for its cave dwellings and once the home of Granada's
large gypsy community. Here we enjoy a Scenic exclusive: an evening of authentic flamenco
dancing in the caves. Retire to the Palacio de Santa Paola,located
in the historic centre, surrounded by stunning garden terraces.
Just staying at a hotel like this is an experience all in itself. It’s actually a 500 year
old convent that’s been completely restored to look exactly as it would of in the 16th Century.
A short trip finds us in Cordoba
For a guided visit of the incredible Mezquita, a Gothic Christian cathedral housed inside a large Moorish Mosque.
The temple is more than an historical and archaeological monument;
it is the unique embodiment of over eight centuries of architectural and artistic change.
Travel to Ronda, one of Andalucia's loveliest towns, steeped in history.
It stands on a towering plateau in the mountains of Malaga Province
and is famous for the plunging river gorge which divides the medieval and 18th century
parts of the town. We’re only about an hour from Marbella
but this just feels like a completely different world. You know everyone I have
spoken to who has been to Andalucia says that Ronda is their absolute highlight of Spain.
Ronda is also famous for its bullring, which we will enjoy a guided visit of.
It is the oldest and the most beautiful in Spain and the arena itself is also the country's largest.
We continue towards the Portuguese border to Seville
one of Spain's most charming cities.
Enjoy exploring the city sights including the Cathedral
housing the tomb of Christopher Columbus and step aboard a horse drawn carriage which will
wind through the city’s streets and alleyways.
Bidding adios to Spain for a few days, we embark on our discovery of Portugal and drive
to the nations capital, Lisbon.
Portugal is one of the smallest countries in Europe
But what it lacks in size
It certainly makes up for in personality.
In Lisbon, we visit the lovely port area, the Alfama (Al-Fam-A) Quarter, with its picturesque
cobbled streets and the Avenida de Liberdade (Aven-Knee-Da der Liber-Dad)
The monument to the famous Portuguese explorers – as well as the Belem (bell-eim) Tower.
Our picturesque drive north will take us through gorgeous seaside villages such as Nazare (Naz-are-Eh),
where we’ll enjoy time at leisure to stroll the quaint streets filled with hospitable
locals before our journey continues to the UNESCO World Heritage city of Porto.
Located on the Douro River Estuary in Northern Portugal, Porto is one of the oldest European
centres and was once an outpost of the Roman Empire. Among the highlights of our stay in
Porto is a special dinner cruise aboard a traditional ‘Rabelo’(har-bell-o) boat
in this fabulously pretty city and a tasting of the city’s namesake.
Crossing the border back into Spain, we are bound for Salamanca where you’ll be in awe
of the beauty of the many historical buildings including the majestic university which was
founded in the year 1218.
We travel back to Madrid, where we will spend two nights experiencing the best
that this lively Spanish capital has to offer! We’ll visit the Prado Museum with our expert
art guide, we’ll visit the famous Plaza Mayor and the bustling Puerta (Port-ah) del
Sol and Plaza de Espana, as well as the 18th Century Royal Palace.
You’ll have a fun filled afternoon where you may try your hand, and your feet, at a
local ‘Tablao’ (tab-lowe) for a fun and energetic afternoon of Flamenco Dance,
Or for the sportsters you may choose to visit the Bernabeau Football stadium as well as
the Trophy Museum of Real Madrid!
On our journey we’ll meet the locals
at the charming villages, explore UNESCO World Heritage sites and cities, and absorb
the intoxicating culture that is unmistakably Spain & Portugal. .
If you would like to extend your journey and discover more of Europe’s treasures, some
only accessible by water, why not add a river cruise along Europe’s grand waterways?
New in 2016, Scenic’s newest spaceship will begin to cruise the Douro river
from Portugal to Spain.
This river cruise will let you see the best of Portugal and its famed Douro Valley
Discover this regions colourful history or simply enjoy the tantalizing tastes and flavours of one
of Europe’s Hidden gems.
Spain and Portugal in all inclusive Luxury, So wonderfully Scenic.
